M:ADJ.comment: 형용사가 누락되었습니다. 따라서 적절한 형용사 added_word가 추가되었습니다.

example_1.before: She can read music quickly than I can.
example_1.after: She can read music more quickly than I can.

example_2.before: Over the last years, I have grown a lot.
example_2.after: Over the few last years, I have grown a lot.

U:ADJ.comment: 형용사 wrong_word는 필요 없거나 부적절해 보입니다. 불필요한 단어로 삭제되었습니다.

example_1.after: It's a tiny kitten.

example_2.before: I want to communicate with other people from other countries.
example_2.after: I want to communicate with people from other countries.

R:ADJ.comment: 형용사 wrong_word는 어색하거나 모호해 보입니다. 어울리는 단어로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.after: The road is very narrow.

example_2.after: I need many apples.

example_1.before: He wakes in the morning.
example_1.after: He wakes up in the morning.

example_2.before: Please speak in the library.
example_2.after: Please speak quietly in the library.

U:ADV.comment: 부사 wrong_word는 필요 없거나 부적절해 보입니다. 불필요한 단어로 삭제되었습니다.

example_1.before: They returned back home after the game.
example_1.after: They returned home after the game.

example_2.before: The cake was highly delicious and sweet.
example_2.after: The cake was delicious and sweet.

R:ADV.comment: 부사 wrong_word는 어색하거나 모호해 보입니다. 어울리는 단어로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.after: My old bed is not very comfortable.

example_2.before: I threw my ball away without cleaning it before.
example_2.after: I threw my ball away without cleaning it beforehand.

example_1.before: I like apples bananas.
example_1.after: I like apples and bananas.

example_2.before: It was late, they continued to work.
example_2.after: It was late, but they continued to work.

example_1.after: I like apples, bananas, and tomatoes.

example_2.before: Choose one, orange or banana or strawberry.
example_2.after: Choose one, orange, banana, or strawberry.

example_1.after: I don't like either broccoli or beans.

example_2.before: He loves both swimming but hiking in the mountains.
example_2.after: He loves both swimming and hiking in the mountains.

example_1.after: Can you pass me the salt, please?

example_1.after: He was sent to prison for two years.

example_2.before: The Amazon River is the largest river by discharge volume of the water.
example_2.after: The Amazon River is the largest river by discharge volume of water.

R:DET.comment: 한정사 wrong_word는 어색하거나 모호해 보입니다. 어울리는 단어로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.after: I saw a cat.

example_2.after: She ate many apples for breakfast.

example_1.after: Remember to wash your hands before dinner.

example_2.before: When I go to the beach, I always bring to sit on.

U:NOUN.comment: 명사 wrong_word는 필요 없거나 부적절해 보입니다. 불필요한 단어로 삭제되었습니다.

example_1.after: Please input your PIN into the ATM.

R:NOUN.comment: 명사 wrong_word는 어색하거나 모호해 보입니다. 어울리는 단어로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.after: His apartment is bigger than hers.

example_2.after: He put on his boots for the hike.

example_1.after: We need to cut back on expenses.

example_2.before: She's been waiting him over an hour.
example_2.after: She's been waiting for him for over an hour.

U:PART.comment: 관사 wrong_word는 필요 없거나 부적절해 보입니다. 불필요한 단어로 삭제되었습니다.

example_1.before: It's good to see you, find about your new hairstyles.
example_1.after: It's good to see you, find out about your new hairstyles.

example_2.before: She discussed about the issue for hours.
example_2.after: She discussed the issue for hours.

R:PART.comment: 관사 wrong_word는 어색하거나 모호해 보입니다. 어울리는 단어로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.before: They agreed with the plan
example_1.after: They agreed on the plan.

example_2.before: Let's think to the proposal and decide tomorrow.
example_2.after: Let's think about the proposal and decide tomorrow.

example_1.after: She's scared of going out alone at night.

example_1.before: She exited out of the building.
example_1.after: She exited the building.

example_2.before: She has a lot of to do before moving.

example_1.after: She is married to a dentist.

example_2.after: They will follow up on the issue next week.

example_1.after: She went to visit her aunt in New York.

example_1.after: The man who was sitting next to me had a brown jacket.

example_2.before: She did it herself alone.

R:PRON.comment: 대명사 wrong_word는 어색하거나 모호해 보입니다. 어울리는 단어로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.before: John is my friend and she is very kind.
example_1.after: John is my friend and he is very kind.

example_2.after: I taught myself how to bake a cake.

M:PUNCT.comment: 문장부호가 누락되었습니다. added_word으로 적절한 문장부호가 추가되었습니다.

example_1.after: My favorite song is "Over the Rainbow."

example_1.after: She opened the door and walked to her car.

example_2.after: A lot of great music was created in the 80s.

R:PUNCT.comment: wrong_word는 문장부호가 어색하거나 모호해 보입니다. 다른 문장부호로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.after: She loves reading; she goes to the library often.

example_2.before: He bought some items. Such as a tent, bag, and a backpack.
example_2.after: He bought some items, such as a tent, bag, and a backpack.

example_1.after: While she was walking, she listened to music.

example_2.before: It thirty minutes to go home.
example_2.after: It takes thirty minutes to go home.

U:VERB.comment: 동사 wrong_word는 필요 없거나 부적절해 보입니다. 불필요하므로 삭제되었습니다.

example_1.before: If I will miss the train, I'll take the next one.
example_1.after: If i miss the train, I'll take the next one.

example_2.before: It is rains a lot in July.
example_2.after: It rains a lot in July,

R:VERB.comment: 동사 wrong_word는 어색하거나 모호해 보입니다. 어울리는 단어로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.before: He made one hundred marks.
example_1.after: He scored one hundred marks.

example_2.before: If it doesn't rain tomorrow, we would go to the beach.
example_2.after: If it doesn't rain tomorrow, we will go to the beach.

example_1.before: I knew you loved my story. Now I tell you about it.
example_1.after: I knew you loved my story. Now I'll tell you about it.

example_2.before: Its a long way from here.
example_2.after: It's a long way from here.

example_1.before: There's many reasons to support this argument.
example_1.after: There are many reasons to support this argument.

example_2.before: Let's go back to you're place.
example_2.after: Let's go back to your place.

R:CONTR.comment: wrong_word는 축약이 어색하거나 부적절하므로, 올바르게 변경되었습니다.

example_1.before: The dog wagged it's tail.
example_1.after: The dog wagged its tail.

example_2.before: You shouldn't play computer games now, shouldn't you?
example_2.after: You shouldn't play computer games now, should you?

R:MORPH.comment: wrong_word의 형태가 올바르지 않습니다. 올바른 형태로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.before: The broke vase is on the table.
example_1.after: The broken vase is on the table.

example_2.before: Can you move it careful? It's fragile.
example_2.after: Can you move it carefully? It's fragile.

R:ORTH.comment: 대소문자가 구분되지 않았거나 공백 오류가 있습니다. added_word으로 올바르게 변경되었습니다.

example_1.after: It's a lot of fun to travel to America.

example_2.before: She gave him a birth day card and a giftwrap.
example_2.after: She gave him a birthday card and gift wrap.

example_1.before: This is the book that everyong is talking.
example_1.after: This is the book that everyone is talking about.

example_2.before: If you can learn a lot and you're good at, you'll also earn some money.
example_2.after: If you can learn a lot and you're good at it, you'll also earn some money.

U:OTHER.comment: wrong_word가 필요 없거나 부적절해 보입니다. 불필요하므로 삭제되었습니다.

example_1.before: What a beautiful is the sunset!
example_1.after: What a beautiful sunset!

example_2.before: This is the way how I did it.
example_2.after: This is how I did it.

R:OTHER.comment: wrong_word가 어색하거나 모호해 보입니다. added_word으로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.before: The box was small if heavy.
example_1.after: The box was small but heavy.

example_2.before: That's not mine book. It's yours.
example_2.after: That's not my book. It's yours.

example_1.before: I believe love will change the way of our lifes.
example_1.after: I believe love will change the way of our lives.

example_2.before: She accidently dropped the glass.
example_2.after: She accidentally dropped the glass.

R:WO.comment: 단어의 순서가 올바르지 않습니다. 올바른 위치에 오도록 added_word으로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.after: She has a small red new car.

example_2.before: She does always her homework on time.
example_2.after: She always does her homework on time.

R:ADJ:FORM.comment: 형용사 wrong_word의 형태가 올바르지 않습니다, 올바른 형태로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.after: Joe is taller than his sister.

example_2.before: I wanted to have fun with my family, but it was worse dinner of my life.
example_2.after: I wanted to have fun with my family, but it was worst dinner of my life.

R:NOUN:INFL.comment: 셀 수 있는 명사와 셀 수 없는 명사 형태의 오류입니다. 올바른 형태 added_word으로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.before: She has interesting informations to share.
example_1.after: She has interesting information to share.

example_2.before: Many campers do a lot of campings in the spring and fall seasons.
example_2.after: Many campers do a lot of camping in the spring and fall seasons.

M:NOUN:POSS.comment: 알맞은 소유격 형태가 되도록 added_word가 추가되었습니다.

example_1.before: It's the right thing to respect older people lives.
example_1.after: It's the right thing to respect older people's lives.

example_2.before: Peter mom is a teacher.
example_2.after: Peter's mom is a teacher.

U:NOUN:POSS.comment: wrong_word의 소유격 형태가 필요 없거나 부적절해보이므로, 삭제되었습니다.

example_1.after: My family members communicate a lot during dinner time.

example_2.after: The concert tickets are sold out.

R:NOUN:POSS.comment: wrong_word의 소유격 형태가 어색하거나 부적절해보이므로, 올바르게 변경되었습니다.

example_1.before: The childrens' playground is new.
example_1.after: The children's playground is new.

example_2.before: The table's leg is broken.
example_2.after: The leg of the table is broken.

example_1.before: He had a dream that was be a superhero.
example_1.after: He had a dream that was to be a superhero.

example_2.before: Swimming is a relaxing activity for me, but children like disturbing me.
example_2.after: Swimming is a relaxing activity for me, but children like to disturb me.

example_1.after: I have learned a lot about many ways to find or orientate myself.

example_2.before: I go and am finding it.
example_2.after: I go and find it.

R:VERB:FORM.comment: 동명사/부정사 wrong_word는 어색하거나 모호해 보입니다. added_word으로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.before: I'm interested in to learn a new language.
example_1.after: I'm interested in learning a new language.

example_2.before: I'm sorry to have kept you waited.
example_2.after: I'm sorry to have kept you waiting.

R:VERB:INFL.comment: wrong_word의 동사 시제 형태가 올바르지 않습니다. 시제에 맞는 동사 형태 added_word으로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.before: The boys start their adventure on stoping them.
example_1.after: The boys start their adventure on stopping them.

example_2.before: She eated lunch an hour ago.
example_2.after: She ate lunch an hour ago.

R:VERB:SVA.comment: 주어와 wrong_word가 일치하지 않습니다. 단수 주어는 단수 동사, 복수 주어는 복수형 동사가 오도록 올바른 단어 added_word 변경되었습니다.

example_1.after: The list of items is on the desk.

example_2.before: Nobody know the answer.
example_2.after: Nobody knows the answer.

example_1.after: The first one is named Amanda Junior.

example_2.before: The city change a lot since I last visited.
example_2.after: The city has changed a lot since I last visited.

U:VERB:TENSE.comment: wrong_word가 필요 없거나 부적절해 보입니다. 불필요하므로 삭제되었습니다.

example_1.after: She did it yesterday.

example_2.after: She will be living in Paris in the near future.

R:VERB:TENSE.comment: wrong_word가 어색하거나 모호해 보입니다. 어울리는 단어로 변경되었습니다.

example_1.before: He was walking home when he meets his old friend.
example_1.after: He was walking home when he met his old friend.

example_2.before: I wish I have a million dollar.
example_2.after: I wish I had a million dollar.

R:NOUN:NUM.comment: wrong_word의 명사의 수가 올바르지 않습니다. added_word으로 올바르게 변경되었습니다.

example_1.after: Why are books so common and cheap today?
